Detailed Description

Drive a multiplexed LED matrix.

Author:
M. P. Hayes, UCECE
Date:
28 March 2007
Note:
This only supports a single instance.

Define Documentation

#define ROWBIT ( N   )     BIT(N)

Referenced by lmatrix_set(), and lmatrix_write().

Function Documentation

lmatrix_t lmatrix_init ( lmatrix_obj_t *  info  ) 

INFO is a pointer into RAM that stores the state of the LMATRIX. The returned handle is passed to the other lmatrix_xxx routines to denote the LMATRIX to operate on. Currently only one lmatrix instance is supported with parameters specified by target.h.

References lmatrix_private_t::col, lmatrix_private_t::col_port, and lmatrix_private_t::state.

void lmatrix_set ( lmatrix_t  lmatrix,
uint8_t  row,
uint8_t  col,
bool  val 
)

Set a pixel in the LED matrix to state VAL at ROW and COL.

References ROWBIT, and lmatrix_private_t::state.

void lmatrix_update ( lmatrix_t  lmatrix  ) 

Scan the LED matrix. This needs to be called at a rate of at least 20 Hz * LMATRIX_COLS to avoid noticeable flicker.

References lmatrix_port_t::bitmask, lmatrix_private_t::col, lmatrix_private_t::col_port, lmatrix_port_t::port, and lmatrix_private_t::state.

void lmatrix_write ( lmatrix_t  lmatrix,
uint8_t *  screen,
uint8_t *  map
